p: As mentioned previously, the main compounds identified in SCWE essential oil are furfural, guaiacol, and 2-butanone, 4-phenyl, which have many applications. Furfural (C5H4O2) is a heterocyclic aldehyde and a natural main product of xylose or lignocellulose decomposition [ 44, 45]. Furfural is known for its biological activities, toxicity, and antibacterial activity [ 46]. Guaiacol (C 7H 8O 2), meanwhile, is an important phenolic compound, with a strong antioxidant activity [ 47, 48]. Guaiacol is also known to have potent anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer activities [ 47]. 2-butanone, 4-phenyl (also known as benzylacetone) is a ketone that is used as additives in the production of cosmetics, soap, perfume, and food [ 49]. It is also an important pharmacologically bioactive compound, which explains the use of A. malaccensis wood in traditional medicine [ 50].
